CatDescriptText: D.S.Ketchum, corporation vice president, East End, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 10, 1962, pg. 11 with question: "Do you think a shorter work week is the answer to the job loss posed by automation?" Answer reads: "We should use as much of labor and our machines as possible becasue with us, it's not a matter of distribution of our products, but whether or not we can both produce and distribute..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of D.S. Ketchum wearing fedora, dark overcoat, and diagonally striped tie, posed in front of door
